verses.verse: Then<WG5119> spoke<WG2980> Jesus<WG2424> to the multitude,<WG3793> and to his disciples,<WG3101>
Saying <WG3004> The scribes<WG1122> and the Pharisees<WG5330> sit<WG2523> in Moses'<WG3475> seat: <WG2515>

All<WG3956> therefore<WG3767> whatever <WG3745> <WG302> they bid<WG2036> you observe, <WG5083> that observe<WG5083> and do;<WG4160> but do<WG4160> not you after<WG2596> their works:<WG2041> for they say,<WG3004> and do<WG4160> not.

For they bind<WG1195> heavy<WG926> burdens<WG5413> and grievous<WG1418> to be borne,<WG1418> and lay <WG2007> them on<WG1909> men's<WG444> shoulders;<WG5606> but they themselves will<WG2309> not move<WG2795> them with one of their fingers. <WG1147>

But all<WG3956> their works<WG2041> they do<WG4160> for to be seen<WG2300> of men:<WG444> they make<WG4115> broad<WG4115> their phylacteries,<WG5440> and enlarge<WG3170> the borders<WG2899> of their garments, <WG2440>
And love<WG5368> the uppermost<WG4411> rooms<WG4411> at<WG1722> feasts,<WG1173> and the chief<WG4410> seats<WG4410> in the synagogues, <WG4864>
And greetings<WG783> in the markets,<WG58> and to be called<WG2564> of men,<WG444> Rabbi,<WG4461> Rabbi. <WG4461>
But be not you called<WG2564> Rabbi:<WG4461> for one<WG1520> is your<WG5216> Master, <WG2519> even Christ;<WG5547> and all<WG3956> you are brothers. <WG80>
And call<WG2564> no <WG3361> man your<WG5216> father<WG3962> on the earth:<WG1093> for one<WG1520> is your<WG5216> Father,<WG3962> which<WG3588> is in heaven. <WG3772>
Neither<WG3366> be you called<WG2564> masters:<WG2519> for one<WG1520> is your<WG5216> Master, <WG2519> even Christ. <WG5547>
But he that is greatest<WG3187> among you shall be your<WG5216> servant. <WG1249>
And whoever<WG3748> shall exalt<WG5312> himself<WG1438> shall be abased;<WG5013> and he that shall humble<WG5013> himself<WG1438> shall be exalted. <WG5312>

But woe<WG3759> to you, scribes<WG1122> and Pharisees,<WG5330> hypocrites!<WG5273> for you shut<WG2808> up the kingdom<WG932> of heaven<WG3772> against<WG1715> men:<WG444> for you neither<WG3761> go<WG1525> in yourselves, neither<WG3756> suffer<WG863> you them that are entering<WG1525> to go<WG1525> in.

Woe<WG3759> to you, scribes<WG1122> and Pharisees,<WG5330> hypocrites!<WG5273> for you devour<WG2719> widows'<WG5503> houses,<WG3614> and for a pretense<WG4392> make<WG4336> long<WG3117> prayer:<WG4336> therefore <WG1223> <WG5124> you shall receive<WG2983> the greater<WG4055> damnation. <WG2917>

Woe<WG3759> to you, scribes<WG1122> and Pharisees,<WG5330> hypocrites!<WG5273> for you compass<WG4013> sea<WG2281> and land<WG3584> to make<WG4160> one<WG1520> proselyte,<WG4339> and when<WG3752> he is made,<WG1096> you make<WG4160> him twofold<WG1366> more the child<WG5207> of hell<WG1067> than yourselves. <WG5216>

Woe<WG3759> to you, you blind<WG5185> guides,<WG3595> which<WG3588> say,<WG3004> Whoever <WG3739> <WG302> shall swear<WG3660> by the temple,<WG3485> it is nothing;<WG3762> but whoever <WG3739> <WG302> shall swear<WG3660> by the gold<WG5557> of the temple,<WG3485> he is a debtor! <WG3784>
You fools<WG3474> and blind:<WG5185> for whether<WG5101> is greater,<WG3187> the gold,<WG5557> or<WG2228> the temple<WG3485> that sanctifies<WG37> the gold? <WG5557>
And, Whoever <WG3739> <WG1437> shall swear<WG3660> by the altar,<WG2379> it is nothing;<WG3762> but whoever <WG3739> <WG302> swears<WG3660> by the gift<WG1435> that is on it, he is guilty. <WG3784>
You fools<WG3474> and blind:<WG5185> for whether <WG5101> is greater,<WG3187> the gift,<WG1435> or<WG2228> the altar<WG2379> that sanctifies<WG37> the gift? <WG1435>
Whoever<WG3588> therefore<WG3767> shall swear<WG3660> by the altar,<WG2379> swears<WG3660> by it, and by all<WG3956> things thereon. <WG1883> <WG846>
And whoever<WG3588> shall swear<WG3660> by the temple,<WG3485> swears<WG3660> by it, and by him that dwells<WG2730> therein.
And he that shall swear<WG3660> by heaven,<WG3772> swears<WG3660> by the throne<WG2362> of God,<WG2316> and by him that sits<WG2521> thereon. <WG1883> <WG846>

Woe<WG3759> to you, scribes<WG1122> and Pharisees,<WG5330> hypocrites!<WG5273> for you pay<WG586> tithe<WG586> of mint<WG2238> and anise<WG432> and cummin,<WG2951> and have omitted<WG863> the weightier <WG926> matters of the law,<WG3551> judgment,<WG2920> mercy,<WG1656> and faith:<WG4102> these<WG5023> ought<WG1163> you to have done,<WG4160> and not to leave<WG863> the other<WG2548> undone.
You blind<WG5185> guides,<WG3595> which<WG3588> strain<WG1368> at<WG1368> a gnat,<WG2971> and swallow<WG2666> a camel. <WG2574>

Woe<WG3759> to you, scribes<WG1122> and Pharisees,<WG5330> hypocrites!<WG5273> for you make<WG2511> clean<WG2511> the outside<WG1855> of the cup<WG4221> and of the platter,<WG3953> but within<WG2081> they are full<WG1073> of extortion<WG724> and excess. <WG192>

You blind<WG5185> Pharisee,<WG5330> cleanse<WG2511> first<WG4412> that which<WG3588> is within<WG1787> the cup<WG4221> and platter,<WG3953> that the outside<WG1622> of them may be clean<WG2513> also. <WG2532>

Woe<WG3759> to you, scribes<WG1122> and Pharisees,<WG5330> hypocrites!<WG5273> for you are like<WG3945> to white washed<WG2867> sepulchers,<WG5028> which<WG3748> indeed<WG3303> appear<WG5316> beautiful<WG5611> outward,<WG1855> but are within<WG2081> full<WG1073> of dead <WG3498> men's bones,<WG3747> and of all<WG3956> uncleanness. <WG167>
Even so<WG3779> you also<WG2532> outwardly<WG1855> appear<WG5316> righteous<WG1342> to men,<WG444> but within<WG2081> you are full<WG3324> of hypocrisy<WG5272> and iniquity. <WG458>

Woe<WG3759> to you, scribes<WG1122> and Pharisees,<WG5330> hypocrites!<WG5273> because<WG3754> you build<WG3618> the tombs<WG5028> of the prophets,<WG4396> and garnish<WG2885> the sepulchers<WG3419> of the righteous, <WG1342>
And say,<WG3004> If<WG1487> we had been<WG2258> in the days<WG2250> of our fathers,<WG3962> we would not have been<WG2258> partakers<WG2844> with them in the blood<WG129> of the prophets. <WG4396>
Why<WG5620> you be witnesses<WG3140> to yourselves,<WG1438> that you are the children<WG5207> of them which killed<WG5407> the prophets. <WG4396>
Fill<WG4137> you up then<WG2532> the measure<WG3358> of your<WG5216> fathers. <WG3962>
You serpents, <WG3789> you generation<WG1081> of vipers,<WG2191> how<WG4459> can you escape <WG5343> <WG575> the damnation<WG2920> of hell? <WG1067>

Why, <WG1223> <WG5124> behold,<WG2400> I send<WG649> to you prophets,<WG4396> and wise<WG4680> men, and scribes:<WG1122> and some of them you shall kill<WG615> and crucify;<WG4717> and some of them shall you whip<WG3146> in your<WG5216> synagogues,<WG4864> and persecute <WG1377> them from city<WG4172> to city: <WG4172>

That on you may come<WG2064> all<WG3956> the righteous<WG1342> blood<WG129> shed<WG1632> on the earth,<WG1093> from the blood<WG129> of righteous<WG1342> Abel<WG6> to the blood<WG129> of Zacharias<WG2197> son<WG5207> of Barachias,<WG914> whom<WG3739> you slew<WG5407> between<WG3342> the temple<WG3485> and the altar. <WG2379>
Truly<WG281> I say<WG3004> to you, All<WG3956> these<WG5023> things shall come<WG2240> on this<WG5026> generation. <WG1074>

O Jerusalem,<WG2419> Jerusalem, <WG2419> you that kill<WG615> the prophets,<WG4396> and stone<WG3036> them which are sent<WG649> to you, how often<WG4212> would<WG2309> I have gathered<WG1996> your children<WG5043> together,<WG1996> even <WG3739> <WG5158> as a hen<WG3733> gathers<WG1996> her chickens<WG3556> under <WG5259> her wings,<WG4420> and you would<WG2309> not!
Behold,<WG2400> your<WG5216> house<WG3624> is left<WG863> to you desolate. <WG2048>

For I say<WG3004> to you, You shall not see<WG1492> me from now on, <WG575> <WG737> till<WG2193> you shall say,<WG2036> Blessed <WG2127> is he that comes<WG2064> in the name<WG3686> of the Lord. <WG2962>
